channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Analysing Discrete Self Supervised Speech Representation for Spoken Language Modeling
item.description: Following the findings of such an analysis, we propose practical improvements to the discrete unit for the GSLM.

item.title: ConvNeXt V2: Co-designing and Scaling ConvNets with Masked Autoencoders
item.description: This co-design of self-supervised learning techniques and architectural improvement results in a new model family called ConvNeXt V2, which significantly improves the performance of pure ConvNets on various recognition benchmarks, including ImageNet classification, COCO detection, and ADE20K segmentation.

item.title: Argoverse 2: Next Generation Datasets for Self-Driving Perception and Forecasting
item.description: Models are tasked with the prediction of future motion for "scored actors" in each scenario and are provided with track histories that capture object location, heading, velocity, and category.

item.title: Credible Remote Sensing Scene Classification Using Evidential Fusion on Aerial-Ground Dual-view Images
item.description: Based on this uncertainty, a novel decision-level fusion strategy is proposed to ensure that the view with lower risk obtains more weight, making the classification more credible.

item.title: Fusing Models for Prognostics and Health Management of Lithium-Ion Batteries Based on Physics-Informed Neural Networks
item.description: Physics-Informed Neural Network (PINN) is an efficient tool to fuse empirical or physical dynamic models with data-driven models.

item.title: PCRLv2: A Unified Visual Information Preservation Framework for Self-supervised Pre-training in Medical Image Analysis
item.description: Recent advances in self-supervised learning (SSL) in computer vision are primarily comparative, whose goal is to preserve invariant and discriminative semantics in latent representations by comparing siamese image views.

item.title: Correlation Clustering Algorithm for Dynamic Complete Signed Graphs: An Index-based Approach
item.description: In this paper, we reduce the complexity of approximating the correlation clustering problem from $O(m\times\left( 2+ \alpha (G) \right)+n)$ to $O(m+n)$ for any given value of $\varepsilon$ for a complete signed graph with $n$ vertices and $m$ positive edges where $\alpha(G)$ is the arboricity of the graph.

item.title: Optimizing Readability Using Genetic Algorithms
item.description: An exhaustive study on a substantial number and diversity of texts confirms that our method was able to optimize the degree of readability in all cases without significantly altering their form or meaning.

item.title: Symbolic Visual Reinforcement Learning: A Scalable Framework with Object-Level Abstraction and Differentiable Expression Search
item.description: Learning efficient and interpretable policies has been a challenging task in reinforcement learning (RL), particularly in the visual RL setting with complex scenes.

item.title: On the Interpretability of Attention Networks
item.description: In trained models with an attention mechanism, the outputs of an intermediate module that encodes the segment of input responsible for the output is often used as a way to peek into the `reasoning` of the network.

item.title: Monge-Kantorovich Optimal Transport Through Constrictions and Flow-rate Constraints
item.description: We quantify flow-rate constraints via a bound on a sought probability density of the times that mass-elements cross toll stations and cast the transportation scheduling in a Kantorovich-type of formalism.

item.title: Detecting Change Intervals with Isolation Distributional Kernel
item.description: The data-dependent property and finite feature map of IDK enabled iCID to efficiently identify various types of change points in data streams with the tolerance of noise points.

item.title: Node-Element Hypergraph Message Passing for Fluid Dynamics Simulations
item.description: We implement a message-passing network on such a node-element hypergraph and explore the capability of the network for the modeling of fluid flow.

item.title: Black-box language model explanation by context length probing
item.description: We present context length probing, a novel explanation technique for causal language models, based on tracking the predictions of a model as a function of the length of available context, and allowing to assign differential importance scores to different contexts.

item.title: Hierarchical Forgery Classifier On Multi-modality Face Forgery Clues
item.description: Face forgery detection plays an important role in personal privacy and social security.

item.title: UBIWEAR: An end-to-end, data-driven framework for intelligent physical activity prediction to empower mHealth interventions
item.description: To this end, we propose UBIWEAR, an end-to-end framework for intelligent physical activity prediction, with the ultimate goal to empower data-driven goal-setting interventions.

item.title: Risk-Sensitive Policy with Distributional Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Classical reinforcement learning (RL) techniques are generally concerned with the design of decision-making policies driven by the maximisation of the expected outcome.

item.title: HPointLoc: Point-based Indoor Place Recognition using Synthetic RGB-D Images
item.description: To study the main stages of solving the place recognition problem on the HPointLoc dataset, we proposed a new modular approach named as PNTR.

item.title: Unsupervised 4D LiDAR Moving Object Segmentation in Stationary Settings with Multivariate Occupancy Time Series
item.description: In this work, we address the problem of unsupervised moving object segmentation (MOS) in 4D LiDAR data recorded from a stationary sensor, where no ground truth annotations are involved.

item.title: Defense Against Adversarial Attacks on Audio DeepFake Detection
item.description: Audio DeepFakes are artificially generated utterances created using deep learning methods with the main aim to fool the listeners, most of such audio is highly convincing.

item.title: Power Control for 6G Industrial Wireless Subnetworks: A Graph Neural Network Approach
item.description: Interference management techniques such as centralized power control can improve spectral efficiency in dense deployments of such subnetworks.

item.title: Examining Political Rhetoric with Epistemic Stance Detection
item.description: Participants in political discourse employ rhetorical strategies -- such as hedging, attributions, or denials -- to display varying degrees of belief commitments to claims proposed by themselves or others.

item.title: PanDepth: Joint Panoptic Segmentation and Depth Completion
item.description: Understanding 3D environments semantically is pivotal in autonomous driving applications where multiple computer vision tasks are involved.

item.title: GPT Takes the Bar Exam
item.description: Nearly all jurisdictions in the United States require a professional license exam, commonly referred to as "the Bar Exam," as a precondition for law practice.

item.title: HUSP-SP: Faster Utility Mining on Sequence Data
item.description: High-utility sequential pattern mining (HUSPM) has emerged as an important topic due to its wide application and considerable popularity.

item.title: Resolving Task Confusion in Dynamic Expansion Architectures for Class Incremental Learning
item.description: The dynamic expansion architecture is becoming popular in class incremental learning, mainly due to its advantages in alleviating catastrophic forgetting.

item.title: Graph Federated Learning for CIoT Devices in Smart Home Applications
item.description: This paper deals with the problem of statistical and system heterogeneity in a cross-silo Federated Learning (FL) framework where there exist a limited number of Consumer Internet of Things (CIoT) devices in a smart building.

item.title: WL-Align: Weisfeiler-Lehman Relabeling for Aligning Users across Networks via Regularized Representation Learning
item.description: Aligning users across networks using graph representation learning has been found effective where the alignment is accomplished in a low-dimensional embedding space.

item.title: Discriminator-Cooperated Feature Map Distillation for GAN Compression
item.description: In contrast to conventional pixel-to-pixel match methods in feature map distillation, our DCD utilizes teacher discriminator as a transformation to drive intermediate results of the student generator to be perceptually close to corresponding outputs of the teacher generator.

item.title: StyleID: Identity Disentanglement for Anonymizing Faces
item.description: Privacy of machine learning models is one of the remaining challenges that hinder the broad adoption of Artificial Intelligent (AI).

item.title: Shape-Aware Fine-Grained Classification of Erythroid Cells
item.description: BMEC contains 5, 666 images of individual erythroid cells, each of which is extracted from the bone marrow erythroid cell smears and professionally annotated to one of the four types of erythroid cells.

item.title: Learning to Detect Noisy Labels Using Model-Based Features
item.description: Label noise is ubiquitous in various machine learning scenarios such as self-labeling with model predictions and erroneous data annotation.

item.title: Feature learning in neural networks and kernel machines that recursively learn features
item.description: In this work, we isolate the key mechanism driving feature learning in fully connected neural networks by connecting neural feature learning to the average gradient outer product.

item.title: Lexicographic Multi-Objective Reinforcement Learning
item.description: In this work we introduce reinforcement learning techniques for solving lexicographic multi-objective problems.

item.title: Anxolotl, an Anxiety Companion App -- Stress Detection
item.description: Stress has a great effect on people's lives that can not be understated.

item.title: TiG-BEV: Multi-view BEV 3D Object Detection via Target Inner-Geometry Learning
item.description: In this paper, we propose the learning scheme of Target Inner-Geometry from the LiDAR modality into camera-based BEV detectors for both dense depth and BEV features, termed as TiG-BEV.

item.title: A Clustering-guided Contrastive Fusion for Multi-view Representation Learning
item.description: To this end, we utilize a deep fusion network to fuse view-specific representations into the view-common representation, extracting high-level semantics for obtaining robust representation.

item.title: SynCLay: Interactive Synthesis of Histology Images from Bespoke Cellular Layouts
item.description: Tissue image generation based on bespoke cellular layouts through the proposed framework allows users to generate different histological patterns from arbitrary topological arrangement of different types of cells.

item.title: Heterogeneous Graph Contrastive Learning with Meta-path Contexts and Weighted Negative Samples
item.description: We take node embeddings in the coarse view as anchors, and construct positive and negative samples from the fine-grained view.

item.title: Explainable and Lightweight Model for COVID-19 Detection Using Chest Radiology Images
item.description: Deep learning (DL) analysis of Chest X-ray (CXR) and Computed tomography (CT) images has garnered a lot of attention in recent times due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: End-to-End Modeling Hierarchical Time Series Using Autoregressive Transformer and Conditional Normalizing Flow based Reconciliation
item.description: Multivariate time series forecasting with hierarchical structure is pervasive in real-world applications, demanding not only predicting each level of the hierarchy, but also reconciling all forecasts to ensure coherency, i. e., the forecasts should satisfy the hierarchical aggregation constraints.

item.title: Cramming: Training a Language Model on a Single GPU in One Day
item.description: Recent trends in language modeling have focused on increasing performance through scaling, and have resulted in an environment where training language models is out of reach for most researchers and practitioners.

item.title: Part-guided Relational Transformers for Fine-grained Visual Recognition
item.description: This framework, namely PArt-guided Relational Transformers (PART), is proposed to learn the discriminative part features with an automatic part discovery module, and to explore the intrinsic correlations with a feature transformation module by adapting the Transformer models from the field of natural language processing.

item.title: Automatic Recognition and Classification of Future Work Sentences from Academic Articles in a Specific Domain
item.description: This paper presents methods to automatically extract FWS from academic papers and classify them according to the different future directions embodied in the paper's content.

item.title: Evaluating Generalizability of Deep Learning Models Using Indian-COVID-19 CT Dataset
item.description: One of the major concerns in using ma-chine learning (ML) approaches for automatic processing of CT scan images in clinical setting is that these methods are trained on limited and biased sub-sets of publicly available COVID-19 data.

item.title: DeepCuts: Single-Shot Interpretability based Pruning for BERT
item.description: We also analyze our pruning masks and find them to be significantly different from the ones obtained using standard metrics.

item.title: AER: Auto-Encoder with Regression for Time Series Anomaly Detection
item.description: We then propose AER (Auto-encoder with Regression), a joint model that combines a vanilla auto-encoder and an LSTM regressor to incorporate the successes and address the limitations of each method.

item.title: MultiSpider: Towards Benchmarking Multilingual Text-to-SQL Semantic Parsing
item.description: Text-to-SQL semantic parsing is an important NLP task, which greatly facilitates the interaction between users and the database and becomes the key component in many human-computer interaction systems.

item.title: Infusing Definiteness into Randomness: Rethinking Composition Styles for Deep Image Matting
item.description: Inspired by this, we introduce a novel composition style that binds the source and combined foregrounds in a definite triplet.

item.title: From Single-Visit to Multi-Visit Image-Based Models: Single-Visit Models are Enough to Predict Obstructive Hydronephrosis
item.description: Previous work has shown the potential of deep learning to predict renal obstruction using kidney ultrasound images.
